publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3137 Shiona Baird: Fair Milk Prices for Farmers—That the Parliament shares the anger of NFU Scotland over continuing exploitation of dairy farmers by the big four supermarkets, Tesco, Asda, Morrisons and Sainsbury’s, and milk processors; notes new research by the Milk Development Council which reveals that, despite supermarkets increasing the price of a litre of milk by 3.5 pence, virtually none of that increase has been seen by the farmers; remains concerned that farmers are paid less than the costs of producing milk, and calls again for an independent supermarket regulator and a stronger code of conduct to control the trading practices of the big four supermarket chains. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson*, Campbell Martin*, Patrick Harvie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Chris Ballance*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Ms Sandra White*, Rosie Kane*, Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*, Rob Gibson*

S2M-3137 Fair Milk Prices for Farmers (lodged on 2 August 2005) Mr Bruce McFee*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3137 Fair Milk Prices for Farmers (lodged on 2 August 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3137 Fair Milk Prices for Farmers (lodged on 2 August 2005) John Swinburne*, Donald Gorrie*
